Hospitalization Record.Chief Complaint: Experiencing auditory hallucinations and delusional thoughts for the past 1 month

Present Illness.Onset: Symptoms began suddenly 1 month ago at home, with no clear prodromal symptoms or identifiable triggers.
Present Illness.Main Symptoms: The patient reports hearing voices that are not there (auditory hallucinations), having strong beliefs that are not based in reality (delusions), and displaying disorganized thinking, such as difficulty in organizing thoughts and a lack of logical connections.
Present Illness.Accompanying Symptoms: Social withdrawal, experiencing abnormal emotional responses such as inappropriate laughter or crying, and noticeable slow responses during conversations.
Present Illness.Diagnosis and Treatment History: No significant history of mental illness prior to this. The patient was evaluated by a primary care physician and referred for psychiatric evaluation.
Present Illness.General Condition Changes: Patient reports disturbed sleep patterns, poor appetite, and slight weight loss. No changes in urination or defecation reported.

Past History.General Health Condition: Generally healthy with no chronic medical conditions.
Past History.Immunization History: Up to date on all recommended vaccinations.
Past History.Surgery and Trauma History: No history of surgeries or significant traumas.

Personal History.Living Habits: Nonsmoker, drinks alcohol occasionally, no history of drug abuse.
Personal History.Occupation and Working Conditions: Works as a software developer in an indoor office setting.
Personal History.Exposure History: No known exposure to industrial toxins, dust, or radioactive substances.

Marital and Family History.Family History: Family reports no history of schizophrenia or other major mental health disorders. Parents are healthy; has one younger sibling who is also healthy.

Systematic Examination.Skin: No abnormalities detected, normal color and texture.
Systematic Examination.Chest: No deformities, lungs clear to auscultation, heart sounds normal.
Systematic Examination.Limbs: Normal range of motion, no deformities or edema.
Systematic Examination.Nervous System: Alert and oriented, cranial nerves intact, motor strength 5/5 in all extremities, normal reflexes.

Hospitalization Record.Specialist Examination: Mental status examination shows disorganized speech, auditory hallucinations, and delusional thoughts.
Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination: Complete blood count and metabolic panel within normal limits prior to admission. Brain MRI shows no structural abnormalities.
Hospitalization Record.Diagnostic Basis: Diagnosis based on history of hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking, and associated social withdrawal and emotional responses. Confirmed with mental status examination.
Hospitalization Record.Differential Diagnosis: Schizotypal personality disorder (ruled out due to lack of pervasive pattern of social and interpersonal deficits typical of the disorder), depression (ruled out as primary diagnosis due to prevalence of psychotic symptoms), metabolic diseases (ruled out by normal metabolic panel).

Post-Admission Course Records.First Course Record: Patient admitted with symptoms of auditory hallucinations, delusions, social withdrawal, and emotional dysregulation. Initial treatment plan includes starting antipsychotic medication (Risperidone) and cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT).
Post-Admission Course Records.Daily Course Records: Day 1: Patient started on 2mg Risperidone. Reports some drowsiness but no other adverse effects.
Post-Admission Course Records.Senior Physician Rounds Records: Outlined management plan including ongoing Risperidone treatment and initiation of CBT. No contraindications to planned treatment.
Post-Admission Course Records.Handover Records: Patient remains stable; continue antipsychotic medication and monitor for side effects. Engage in regular CBT sessions.
Post-Admission Course Records.Stage Summary: After one week, patient shows mild improvement in symptoms. Voices are less frequent, delusional thoughts are less intrusive, and patient shows increased engagement in therapy. Continue current treatment regimen.
Post-Admission Course Records.Consultation Records: Consult performed with psychiatry confirmed diagnosis and agreed on treatment plan.

Medical Orders.Long-term Orders: Risperidone 2mg daily, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy twice weekly.
Medical Orders.Temporary Orders: CBC and metabolic panel weekly, monitor for side effects of Risperidone.

Hospitalization Record.Auxiliary Examination Reports: Complete blood count, metabolic panel, and brain MRI are normal.
Hospitalization Record.Temperature Chart: Temperature: 36.7°C, Pulse: 72 bpm, Respiration: 16 breaths/min, Blood Pressure: 120/80 mmHg.

Mental Disorders.Name: Schizophrenia
Mental Disorders.Symptoms: Hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking, abnormal emotional responses, social withdrawal, slow responses
Mental Disorders.Differential Diagnosis: Schizotypal personality disorder, depression, metabolic diseases.
